title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Kwan to Jays? Maybe, but pitching comes first
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on Thursday approaches.

title: The one trade our experts would make before the deadline
content: We asked our MLB experts for the one fun, outside-the-box deal they'd make to get things moving along.

title: Shooter targeted NFL HQ, claimed to have CTE
content: A gunman who killed four people at a Manhattan office building was trying to target the headquarters of the NFL but took the wrong elevator.

title: Braves' Acuna headed to IL with Achilles issue
content: Ronald Acuna Jr. exited Atlanta's loss at Kansas City on Tuesday night because of tightness in his right Achilles after chasing down a ball in right field.

title: Browns' Emerson carted off with Achilles injury
content: Browns cornerback Martin Emerson Jr. was carted off the field during Tuesday's practice after suffering an Achilles injury.

title: Jays, Orioles get deal done during doubleheader
content: The Blue Jays have acquired reliever Seranthony Dominguez from the Orioles for pitching prospect Juaron Watts-Brown.

title: Rare Ohtani first: Dodgers star K's in first 4 PAs
content: Dodgers two-way star Shohei Ohtani had another first in his MLB career when he struck out in his first four plate appearances Tuesday night.

title: Sources: Hendrickson set to end Bengals holdout
content: Bengals All-Pro defensive end Trey Hendrickson is set to end his holdout and report for training camp on Wednesday, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Vancouver close to sealing Müller deal
content: The Vancouver Whitecaps are closing in on a deal to sign former Bayern Munich and Germany star Thomas Müller, sources told ESPN.

title: Twins place All-Star Buxton (rib cage) on 10-day IL
content: The Minnesota Twins placed All-Star outfielder Byron Buxton on the 10-day injured list Tuesday as he continues to deal with left rib cage inflammation.

title: Power Rankings: Sparks, Valkyries headed in opposite directions
content: Los Angeles rides a win streak (and Cameron Brink's return) up the latest edition, and Golden State struggles.

title: WNBA trades we want to see: Mabrey to Storm, Hines-Allen to Fever
content: Marina Mabrey, Aaliyah Edwards and Myisha Hines-Allen could be on the move before the trade deadline.

title: Can Bronny James realistically make the Lakers’ rotation in Year 2?
content: After spending Year 1 working away from the spotlight, James hopes it'll translate into playing time with Los Angeles.

title: 'I'm getting that true balance': Dak Prescott's perspective as a dad and longest-tenured Cowboy
content: The quarterback enters Year 10 with the Cowboys, and he is focused on health, family and winning a Super Bowl.

title: Ranking every prospect dealt before the 2025 MLB trade deadline
content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

title: 11 college football teams ready to either build on last season or put it behind them
content: FSU has nowhere to go but up, Michigan can get way better and Arizona State is building on its CFP berth. Which other teams are primed for bigger things in 2025?

title: Way-Too-Early men's Bracketology: Houston is No. 1, and we'll have a new WAC champ
content: Grand Canyon moved up its timeline to switch from the WAC to the Mountain West, which significantly shifts the bracket dynamics.

title: Liverpool won the Premier League and now they're on a spending spree. Why?
content: Fresh off winning the Premier League with few reinforcements, Liverpool are now splashing the cash in the summer transfer window ahead of the 2025-26 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Dortmund eye permanent move for Sancho
content: Jadon Sancho could make a permanent switch back to his old club Borussia Dortmund. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Liverpool still want Alexander Isak amid massive summer spending
content: Liverpool's pursuit of Isak is about future-proofing the team so that they're ready for life beyond Mo Salah.

title: They (finally) meet again: Three keys to Liberty-Lynx WNBA Finals rematch
content: Injuries and new matchups will determine Wednesday's showdown, nine months after New York beat Minnesota for the title.

title: Pelton's NBA offseason grades: Who aced their summer -- and who got the only 'F'
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: 'Just a top-shelf human being': Teammates, opponents remember Ryne Sandberg
content: Beloved on and off the field, Sandberg leaves a lasting legacy in Chicago and throughout the baseball universe.

title: How Ichiro's HOF induction helps tell the story of Japanese baseball
content: On Ichiro Suzuki's induction weekend, a new exhibit in Cooperstown shares his place in the international baseball landscape.

title: Reliever stock watch: Guardians look to Cade Smith
content: As the MLB trade deadline approaches this week, here are the relief pitchers and closers to keep an eye on in fantasy baseball.

title: Six late-round 'fliers' who can help you win your league
content: Hitting on a player late in drafts can be a big boost -- to your team and your ego. Here are six "fliers" you need to be considering.

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton proposes to girlfriend Jade Jones
content: Haliburton staged the proposal inside Hilton Coliseum on the Iowa State campus, where the couple began dating.

title: 'The story's not done yet': England celebrate Euro 2025 win with London parade
content: England partied with 65,000 fans (and Burna Boy) outside Buckingham Palace after winning Euro 2025. But they already have one eye on the World Cup.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: First visuals: Tsunami hits Russia's Kamchatka coast after 8.8 earthquake
content: A strong earthquake struck off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula. It triggered a large tsunami. Coastal areas faced evacuation. Submerged buildings and massive water drenching were seen. The quake's magnitude was 8.7. Tsunami waves reached up to 4 meters. Warnings issued for Japan, Hawaii, and other Pacific regions. People were asked to leave their homes. The earthquake was the strongest in decades.

title: J&K encounter: Forces notice individuals trying to infiltrate; 2 fall down after being hit
content: An encounter initiated in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch sector on Wednesday after security forces intercepted a group of terrorists attempting to infiltrate from across the border. Army officials reported that gunfire was exchanged, and two terrorists were hit. The operation is currently underway as troops investigate the area.

title: 'Are we still stuck in the colonial era?' - Pathan on Gambhir vs The Oval pitch curator saga
content: Tensions flared ahead of the final Test between India and England as a heated argument erupted between India's coach, Gautam Gambhir, and pitch curator Lee Fortis over pitch access. Irfan Pathan's social media post ignited a debate about double standards, questioning why England's coach had pitch access while Gambhir did not.

title: 'Country will be shocked': Why PM Modi slammed Nehru's Indus Waters treaty - 'facts kept hidden'
content: PM Modi criticized the Indus Waters Treaty, highlighting a clause where Nehru allegedly conceded to Pakistan's demands, preventing India from desilting dams and even welding shut a gate on one. Modi claimed this decision, which Nehru later regretted, deprived Indian farmers of water and electricity, benefiting Pakistan at India's expense. India has since suspended the treaty and initiated desilting efforts.

title: US senator sends letter to Musk: Block Starlink in Southeast Asia; says service used by criminals
content: Senator Maggie Hassan has raised concerns about Starlink's use by criminal organizations in Southeast Asia to perpetrate scams against Americans, resulting in billions of dollars in losses. She urges Elon Musk to take action, citing UN reports and law enforcement data indicating widespread misuse of the satellite internet service in scam compounds.

title: 18 balls in one over? Pakistan vs Australia witnesses bizarre moment - Watch
content: In a World Championship of Legends 2025 match, John Hastings bowled a strange over. The over included 12 wides and a no-ball. Pakistan Champions were chasing a small target. Saeed Ajmal took six wickets, dismantling Australia Champions. Sharjeel Khan and Sohaib Maqsood easily secured a 10-wicket victory for Pakistan. Hastings's over became a talking point among fans.

title: 'India good friend but ... ': Trump hints at 20-25% tariff rate
content: President Trump indicated a potential 20-25% tariff on Indian goods, slightly less than the previously announced 26%, amidst ongoing trade negotiations. He stated India's high tariffs prompted the consideration, despite acknowledging their friendship. This levy positions India competitively with Bangladesh in textiles, but behind Vietnam and Indonesia.

title: ‘Significant positive impact’: Australia to ban children from YouTube
content: Australia is set to ban children under 16 from creating YouTube accounts starting in December, reversing its earlier stance. Prime Minister Albanese cites the negative impact of social media on Australian kids, emphasizing the government's support for parents. This decision follows concerns raised by the internet regulator and a survey revealing harmful content encountered by minors on the platform.

title: $5.5 billion wiped in one day: How a Mexican billionaire lost billions in online scam
content: Ricardo Salinas Pliego, a Mexican billionaire, lost a significant portion of his fortune, around $5.5 billion, in a sophisticated "loan-to-own" scam. Con artists posing as descendants of John Jacob Astor lured him into borrowing $400 million against his Grupo Elektra shares.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for July 30 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers recommends buying Mazagon Dock, Vascon Engineers, and Thermax. Mazagon Dock presents a mean reversion opportunity, while Vascon Engineers shows inverse Head & Shoulders pattern with demand zone support. Thermax appears to be retesting after a breakout, indicating a potential uptrend resumption.

title: Head, Hazlewood to return; Marsh to captain Australia - full squad announced
content: Australia have revealed their squads for the South Africa series. Matt Short returns, and Mitch Owen earns his first call-up. Mitchell Marsh will captain the ODI side in Pat Cummins's absence. Travis Head and Josh Hazlewood are back. Select players have been dropped from the previous West Indies series. The team is gearing up for the T20 World Cup.

title: TCS layoffs: Ex Tech Mahindra CEO CP Gurnani quotes Sholay - message to techies
content: Amidst TCS layoffs, CP Gurnani urges the Indian tech industry to move beyond headcount obsession and embrace outcome-based models. He emphasizes a shift from the traditional pyramid structure, advocating for enhanced productivity, specialized skills, and advanced technological capabilities. Experts suggest that upskilling and reskilling are crucial for tech professionals in this evolving landscape.

title: 'Asked to prove citizenship by police, mob': Kargil veteran's family
content: A Kargil war veteran's family in Pune faced a citizenship verification ordeal. They allege a group accompanied by police stormed their home. The family was asked to provide documents to prove their Indian citizenship. Police acted on information about suspected illegal immigrants. The family includes other Army veterans. An investigation is underway regarding the incident.

title: Bihar polls: SC 'overseeing' EC's SIR; to 'step in if there's mass exclusion'
content: The Supreme Court has permitted the Election Commission to release Bihar's draft voter list on August 1, following a special intensive revision. Concerns were raised about potential voter exclusion due to migration or reported deaths. The court emphasized its oversight, promising intervention if mass exclusions occur from the January 2025 voter base.

title: 'Saiyaara' box office day 12: Film set to hit Rs 100 cr mark
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara,' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has grossed an estimated Rs 266 crore in India within 12 days. Sustained weekday collections and positive word-of-mouth indicate continued audience interest. The film is poised to surpass Rs 300 crore, potentially becoming the second Hindi film of 2025 to achieve this milestone.

title: Shannon Sharpe lawsuit: OnlyFans model’s $50 million claim fizzles; payout far lower than expected
content: NFL legend Shannon Sharpe settled a lawsuit with a 20-year-old OnlyFans model. The model initially sued Sharpe for $50 million, alleging sexual assault. Sources indicate Sharpe paid $23 million to resolve the case. Both parties acknowledge a consensual relationship. The model's lawyer confirmed a mutually agreed resolution. Sharpe has not commented publicly on the settlement. He continues his podcast work.

title: 'No sign of govt re-strategising for Pak-China front': Congress in RS
content: In Rajya Sabha, the opposition demanded accountability from Home Minister Amit Shah for security failures leading to the Pahalgam massacre. They questioned PM Modi about the May 10 ceasefire with Pakistan and Donald Trump's alleged role. Opposition leaders criticized the government's lack of strategy against the Pakistan-China front and abstaining from IMF aid to Pakistan.

title: Tsunami scare in US, Japan: 8.8 magnitude earthquake hits Russian coast
content: A major earthquake struck off the Russian coast. The quake triggered a tsunami alert across the Pacific. The United States Geological Survey reported the event. The impact zone included areas near Alaska. Japan also issued a tsunami advisory. Waves of up to one meter were possible. The earthquake occurred near Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula. Initial reports indicate no major damage.

title: Russian, Japan coasts hit with Tsunami waves after powerful earthquake
content: A powerful magnitude 8.7 earthquake struck Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula, triggering tsunami waves up to 4 meters high. Authorities urged residents to evacuate the shoreline as the quake, felt slightly in Japan, caused building damage and prompted evacuations. This tremor marks the strongest in decades, with a kindergarten among the structures affected.

title: Aamir Khan explains: Why Gen Z is obsessed with Ahaan Panday-Aneet Padda starrer Saiyaara
content: Aamir Khan lauded the success of 'Saiyaara,' attributing its popularity among Gen Z to a generational shift in content preferences and emotional storytelling. He aims to create films that resonate with diverse audiences, celebrating 'Saiyaara's' debutants Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda. Khan also announced 'Sitaare Zameen Par' will release globally on YouTube on August 1, 2025.

title: Tom Brady on family toll: Blames football sacrifices for personal rift; hints at Gisele’s concerns about career
content: Tom Brady's recent newsletter delves into his personal life, addressing family, career, and choices. He defends his dedication to football as a form of fatherhood, aiming to set an example for his children through hard work. This message subtly responds to past concerns raised by Gisele Bündchen and the recent Netflix roast, emphasizing that actions reflect priorities.

title: Shooter’s chilling final request: 'Study my brain' plea in suicide note after NFL HQ massacre
content: A tragic shooting in Midtown Manhattan has claimed five lives, including the shooter, Shane Devon Tamura, a former football player. Tamura, who drove from Las Vegas, fatally shot four people at the NFL's corporate offices before killing himself. His suicide note cited CTE and blamed the NFL for his suffering.

title: Gabrielle Union reveals daughter Kaavia obsessed with marriage on vacation
content: Gabrielle Union shared a humorous anecdote about her daughter Kaavia's obsession with marriage during a family vacation in Hawaii. Kaavia, enamored with her best friend Crosby, declared him her husband without his knowledge, leading to comical and awkward situations throughout the trip. Union highlighted Kaavia's bold personality and the family's tradition of escaping to Hawaii for Christmas.

title: Linda Hogan: 'I won’t attend Hulk’s funeral'; claims Brooke won’t either — family rift escalates
content: In a shocking turn, Linda Hogan posted a video alleging Brooke Hogan wouldn't attend Hulk Hogan's funeral, citing past trauma and family issues. The wrestling world mourns Hulk Hogan, who passed away on July 24, 2025, from cardiac arrest. However, the video featuring Brooke was later revealed as an AI-generated fake, sparking further controversy.

title: Vanessa Bryant reacts: Ciara’s sweet post for Russell Wilson; kids shine in family moment
content: Vanessa Bryant showed her support for Russell Wilson's family by commenting on Ciara's Instagram post, which featured the family cheering Wilson at training camp. This gesture highlights the strong bond between Vanessa and Ciara, who have supported each other through various life events, including Kobe Bryant's passing. Their families share a close friendship, celebrating milestones and vacations together.

title: NHL Trade Rumors: Nazem Kadri could join Montreal Canadiens; Toronto Maple Leafs’ move blocked by...
content: Nazem Kadri might be heading to the Montreal Canadiens as Calgary reportedly refuses trades with Toronto. Friction from Brad Treliving's past dealings with Calgary limits Kadri's options. Montreal, with its young core and skilled system, presents an appealing destination for the veteran center, potentially stabilizing their second line and providing valuable leadership.

title: 'Ill-timed': US shuns UN 2-state solution conference; conveys concerns with India
content: The United States has expressed reservations to India regarding the UN 2-state conference, deeming it counterproductive to ending the Gaza conflict and securing hostage releases. Despite US urging, India is participating, seeking constructive engagement towards a 2-state solution. India balances its ties with Israel and its support for the Palestinian cause, advocating for a negotiated resolution.

title: Klay Thompson silent on Megan Thee Stallion case: Rapper wins $5K
content: Megan Thee Stallion recently won a case against YouTuber Milagro Gramz. The case was regarding online harassment after the 2022 shooting incident. A judge ordered Gramz to pay Megan's attorney fees. Klay Thompson, Megan's boyfriend, has remained silent on the matter. The rapper had filed the lawsuit against Gramz for cyberbullying. The lawsuit was filed around late 2024.

title: Taylor, Travis's love confirmed: 'They make each other happy'; NFL insiders weigh in
content: Erin Andrews and Charissa Thompson shared details about their vacation with Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce. The sports media personalities finally spoke about the Montana trip. Charissa Thompson described Swift as everything she had hoped for. Erin Andrews explained their silence, emphasizing their support for the couple. Fans reacted positively to the news, praising the genuineness of Swift and Kelce.

title: Amit Shah uses P Chidambaram's remarks to slam Congress: 'Why shield Pak?'
content: During a Lok Sabha debate on terrorism, Amit Shah accused Congress of shielding Pakistan, citing P. Chidambaram's remarks questioning Pakistan's involvement in attacks. Shah blamed Congress for Pakistan's creation and the failure to reclaim PoK, criticizing Nehru's ceasefire decision and Indus Waters Treaty.

title: Sauce Gardner sparks dating buzz: Buys $200K matching watches with Ice Spice
content: Jets star cornerback Sauce Gardner gifted rapper Ice Spice a Richard Mille watch. The gift sparked relationship rumors. Gardner reportedly spent a lot of money on two watches. One was for himself and another pink watch for Ice Spice. They were earlier spotted dining together in Los Angeles and New York. Fans are excited about this news.

title: Op Sindoor debate: 'Cong gagged Tharoor, Tewari,' says PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi suggested that Shashi Tharoor and Manish Tewari were silenced by the Congress leadership regarding Operation Sindoor, despite their prior involvement in all-party delegations. Modi implied pressure from a single family within Congress was preventing them from speaking truthfully about Pakistan's role in terrorism.

title: Why India called Pak shortly after Op Sindoor strikes? PM Modi explains
content: Narendra Modi addressed the Lok Sabha, defending Operation Sindoor. He stated India informed Pakistan promptly after the operation. Modi criticized Congress for questioning the military's actions. He accused them of undermining the armed forces' morale. Modi blamed Congress for the loss of Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Amit Shah echoed similar views, citing Congress's historical blunders.

title: India tests Pralay quasi-ballistic missile twice for conventional precision strikes
content: India successfully tested its Pralay quasi-ballistic missile, designed for precision strikes up to 500 km, twice off the Odisha coast. These tests pave the way for its induction into the armed forces, enhancing their conventional strike capabilities. The Pralay, crucial for the proposed Integrated Rocket Force, underwent user evaluation trials, validating its range and accuracy.

title: Op Sindoor: 'Why is he scared?' Cong revives Trump charge moments after PM junks it
content: Following PM Modi's denial of external interference in 'Operation Sindoor,' Congress launched a sharp counter-attack, questioning his silence on Donald Trump's claims of mediating between India and Pakistan. Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi, accused Modi of evading direct responses on Trump's assertions and failing to acknowledge China's support to Pakistan.

title: Meghnad Desai, eminent economist, passes away; PM Modi expresses condolences
content: Economist and House of Lords member Meghnad Desai passed away at 85. A former professor at the London School of Economics, Desai was known for his research on development, Marxian economics, and globalisation. Prime Minister Modi expressed condolences, acknowledging Desai's connection to India and his role in strengthening India-UK ties. Desai's influence spanned academia and politics.

title: Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2 1st episode update - check here
content: Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2 opens with Tulsi's reflections on values and family. New characters Ritik, Angad, and Paridhi join the cast. The episode highlights Tulsi's central role in the family, her emotional connection with Baa's memory, and Mihir's surprise anniversary gift.

title: TCS layoffs: Will new bench policy mean more than 12,000 firings? ‘Everyone is scared…’
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) faces employee anxieties as a new bench policy raises fears of layoffs exceeding the announced 12,000. The policy, limiting bench time to 35 days, may disproportionately impact senior staff struggling to secure project assignments quickly.

title: IPL jerseys stolen from Wankhede Stadium by security incharge, sold online
content: Farooque Aslam Khan, a security manager at Wankhede Stadium, has been arrested for allegedly stealing 261 IPL jerseys valued at Rs 6.52 lakh from the BCCI's merchandise store. The theft occurred on June 13, with Khan suspected of selling the stolen jerseys online. Following a complaint filed by BCCI officials, police have recovered 50 jerseys and are continuing their investigation.

title: Tsunami Hits Russia, Japan: Understanding Its Causes, Impacts
content: Tsunami alerts were issued across much of the Pacific on Wednesday after an 8.8 magnitude earthquake off Russia's far east.

title: Tsunami Hits Russia, Japan After Strongest Earthquake Since 2011 In Pacific
content: One of the world's strongest earthquakes struck Russia's Far East early Wednesday, an 8.8-magnitude temblor that set off a tsunami in the northern Pacific region and prompted warnings for Alaska, Hawaii and other coasts south toward New Zealand.

title: Russia Earthquake, Tsunami LIVE: 8.8 Magnitude Kamchatka Quake Is Region's "Strongest Since 1952"
content: Russia Earthquake, Tsunami LIVE Updates:An earthquake of magnitude 8.8 - one of the world's strongest-struck Russia's Far Eastern Kamchatka Peninsula early on Wednesday, generating a tsunami of up to 4 metres (13 feet).

title: NISAR Satellite Embodies 'Strength Respects Strength': ISRO Chief To NDTV
content: In an exclusive interview with NDTV, Dr V Narayanan, Chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), expressed immense pride in the mission, calling it a "life-saving satellite" and a symbol of India's rising leadership in space.

title: Kiren Rijiju's '1971' Counter To Rahul Gandhi's "Political Will" Face-Off
content: After a massive face-off over Operation Sindoor, the centre has pushed back against Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi, who had questioned the government's "political will" to strike at Pakistan during the four-day fiery border confrontation.

title: Workers At Fukushima Plant Evacuate As Quake Near Russia Sparks Tsunami Alert
content: Workers at the stricken Fukushima nuclear plant in northeast Japan were evacuated Wednesday after an 8.7-magnitude earthquake off Russia's far east triggered tsunami warnings around the Pacific.

title: Videos Show Moment 8.8 Magnitude Earthquake Struck Russia's Kamchatka
content: A powerful magnitude 8.7 earthquake struck off Russia's far eastern Kamchatka Peninsula on Wednesday, triggering a Pacific Ocean tsunami warning.

title: Donald Trump's Big Statement On India Tariffs Ahead Of August 1 Deadline
content: President Donald Trump said that India may be hit with a tariff rate of 20% to 25% but cautioned the final levy had still not been finalized as the two countries negotiate on a trade deal ahead of an Aug. 1 deadline.

title: Minor Siblings Dead From Suspected Pesticide Gas At Home In Madhya Pradesh
content: A minor brother-sister duo died and their parents were critical as a result of suspected inhalation of poisonous gas from pesticide-treated wheat stored at their home in Shivpuri district of Madhya Pradesh, police said on Tuesday.

title: Delhi Announces 'Freedom From Garbage' Campaign For Cleanest Constituency
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Tuesday announced cash rewards ranging from Rs 10 lakh to Rs 1 crore for the cleanest RWA, ward, and assembly constituency, based on their performance in the 'Delhi Freedom from Garbage' cleanliness drive.

title: Russia Faces Tariffs In 10 Days If No Progress On Ending Ukraine War, Warns Trump
content: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that the United States would start imposing tariffs and other measures on Russia "10 days from today" if Moscow showed no progress toward ending its more than three-year-long war in Ukraine.

title: Arab Nations Tell Hamas To End Rule In Gaza, Hand Over Weapons
content: Arab countries including Qatar, Saudi Arabia and Egypt joined calls Tuesday for Hamas to disarm and end its rule of Gaza, in a bid to end the devastating war in the Palestinian territory.

title: Australia Adds YouTube To Social Media Ban For Children
content: Australia said on Wednesday it will include Alphabet-owned YouTube in its world-first ban on social media for teenagers, reversing an earlier decision to exempt the video-sharing platform.

title: US Warns China On Russian Oil Purchases That Could Bring 100% Tariffs
content: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Tuesday said he warned Chinese officials that continued purchases of sanctioned Russian oil would lead to big tariffs due to legislation in Congress, but was told that Beijing would protect its energy sovereig

title: Trump Says Epstein "Stole" Young Women From Mar-a-Lago Spa
content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday that Jeffrey Epstein "stole" young women who worked for the spa at Mar-a-Lago, the latest evolution in his description of how their highly scrutinized relationship ended years ago.

title: New York Gunman Was Flagged By Security Camera System Before Attack: Report
content: Cameras at 345 Park Avenue flagged an approaching gunman on Monday as a potential threat that required immediate attention, seconds before he burst into the office skyscraper's lobby and began firing, according to two former federal officials.

title: China, US May Work To Extend Latest Tariff Deadline, Says Chinese Official
content: China's top trade official said Tuesday that China and the U.S. agreed to work on extending a deadline for new tariffs on each other, following a two-day trade meeting in Stockholm. The U.S. side said extension plans were discussed, but not decided.

title: Delhi Residents Can Now Resolve Gas, Loan, Banking Disputes Without Court
content: Residents grappling with issues like loan defaults, gas supply disruptions or service lapses by banks and NBFCs may no longer need to take the long road to court. Delhi Lieutenant Governor has cleared a proposal to treat these three services.

title: Student Jumps Off Rajasthan College Building, Parents Claim She Was Given Drugs
content: A video has emerged from Rajasthan's Tonk, where a woman can first be seen lying in the college corridor with her legs on the wall, and after that, sitting on the parapet of her hostel building.

title: 7 Women From Scheduled Castes, Tribes Raped Every Day In Madhya Pradesh
content: In a startling revelation that lays bare the deep-rooted caste and gender-based violence in Indian society, the Madhya Pradesh government on Tuesday presented data in the state assembly that shows a disturbing pattern of crimes against women

title: Parliament Monsoon session Day 8 LIVE: Jaishankar, Nadda to address Rajya Sabha on Operation Sindoor
content: Opposition MPs yesterday asked the government to explain why India accepted a ceasefire with Pakistan when Pakistan had been on the backfoot

title: RTI Commission dealing with 18,000 pending cases
content: An RTI awareness conference held at Prajavani Hall aimed at training Public Information Officers (PIOs) on the legal provisions and responsibilities under the RTI Act

title: Justice on hold: India’s courts are clogged
content: Civil cases in district courts face the longest delays, exposing a stark mismatch between caseload and capacity

title: Lions Club hands over insulin cartridges to welfare society
content: This was in response to a recent news report in The Hindu, which highlighted the concerns of the children and their parents in view of some changes in the ‘Mittayi’ scheme of the Kerala Social Security Mission

title: Maini Group co-founded SUN Mobility raises $135 million to fund its global foray
content: This capital infusion will drive the company’s plans to set up the largest battery swapping network in Africa and also to fuel SUN Mobility’s domestic growth

title: Conservationists’ fight to protect ‘Perfect Unanimity’, the British-era building on the Marina
content: The episode of the campaign to save the DGP office complex was recalled by many, while mourning the passing of veteran architect-conservationist Tara Murali in Chennai last week

title: Poddar Plumbing to generate tax revenues of ₹3,000 crore for Karnataka government in next 10 years
content: The company plans to invest ₹93 crore for land acquisition, ₹593 crore for industrial machinery and equipment, and ₹87 crore towards GST on capital expenditure

title: Tracing the route of King Rajendra Chola’s Gangetic expedition
content: Accounts reveal the Chola forces defeated kingdoms in the eastern Deccan, coastal Odisha, and eventually clashed with the Pala dynasty in Bengal

title: A.P. CM Naidu discusses partnership in key sectors with Singapore President
content: The Chief Minister emphasises the importance of collaboration in knowledge economy, infrastructure development, semiconductors and renewable energy

title: India’s tea production increases in 2025, Darjeeling’s output remains a concern
content: The production of tea across the country from January to May 2025 stood at 336.22 million kg compared to 267.36 million kg between January to May 2024

title: Army recruitment rally in Kakinada from August 5 to 20
content: The process is fully automated, fair, and transparent, and the candidates are advised to guard against touts

title: Drug menace in Karnataka: BJP Yuva Morcha demands resignation of CM and Home Minister
content: The morcha will take up a campaign against drugs besides launching a Statewide protest against the Congress government for alleged failure to act sternly against the menace

title: Insurance can better cataract surgery outcomes for India’s elderly: study
content: After controlling for other factors, having any insurance made an elderly patient 38% more likely to end up with ‘good’ uncorrected vision, a team from the L.V. Prasad Eye Institute has found

title: Couple booked for alleged bid to extort ₹30 crore from IT firm owner
content: The accused are Swetha Babu and her husband Krishnaraj of Thrissur. The case was registered on a complaint by Venu Gopalakrishnan who runs a company at Infopark Kochi

title: Himachal makes dope testing for ‘Chitta’ mandatory in police recruitment
content: The Cabinet decided to introduce mandatory dope testing for ‘Chitta’ (heroin) during police recruitment

title: NHRC flags food poisoning in Telangana residential schools, seeks report on 886 incidents and 48 student deaths
content: The issue came up for discussion during NHRC’s two-day camp sitting in Hyderabad, where it took up over 100 human rights cases specific to the State

title: Infant rescued in baby-selling racket placed under State care
content: Officials said the infant will undergo routine medical examination while authorities await further directions regarding his custody and care

title: Agilent Tech opens Biopharma Experience Centre in Hyderabad
content: Hyderabad hosts 8 of top 10 global pharma firms, over 230 U.S FDA-approved manufacturing units and five of India’s leading healthcare chains, Industries and IT Minister Sridhar Babu told the inauguration

title: Supriya Sule alleges ‘₹4,800-crore scam’ in Ladki Bahin Yojana
content: Her allegations come two days after the Maharashtra government announced a temporary suspension of ₹1,500 monthly aid to 26.34 lakh beneficiaries following a verification drive

title: Congress MLAs play flute before ‘buffalo’ in unique protest at M.P. Assembly; Speaker asks ministers to give direct answers
content: Congress MLAs enacted the popular Hindi saying ‘bhains ke aage been bajana (playing flute before a buffalo)’ which means that there is no point of saying anything to someone who won’t do anything about it

title: Writers, progressive thinkers oppose reduction of SSLC pass percentage in Karnataka
content: Writers, progressive thinkers, and educationists have written a letter to the Chief Minister in this regard

title: Kerala High Court yet again expresses displeasure at shoddy condition of Kochi roads
content: Potholes abound on MG Road and Banerjee Road; unscientific and damaged manhole covers and undulating paver blocks also a cause for concern, says court

title: Navy Chief on four-day visit to Japan to boost defence and maritime cooperation
content: The Chief Admiral CNS is scheduled to hold bilateral discussions with senior Japanese government officials including Minister of Defence, Gen Nakatani

title: MA&UD approves 11 projects to enhance urban liveability
content: Approved projects include development of waste to energy facility in Kurnool, Kadapa, Nellore and Kakinada-Rajahmundry, construction of a modern bus stand in Chittoor, monetisation of land at Rushikonda and ropeway to Kailasagiri

title: Will make efforts to enhance devotee experience during Dasara: NTR Collector
content: Number of devotees visiting the temple during the 10-day festivities has been increasing every year, and this year around 1 lakh devotees are expected every day, says G. Lakshmisha

title: Five new corporations under GBA: Final notification to come out on September 2
content: Public invited to file objections, if any, to the draft notification by August 18; delimitation process to be conducted on September 8

title: Mamata unfazed after Delhi police claim video she posted was fabricated
content: Hundreds of migrant workers from West Bengal have alleged harassment and torture by police in different states, including Delhi, because they are suspected of being Bangladeshi nationals

title: Chidambaram gave clean chit to Pakistan: Amit Shah
content: The Home Minister says there is evidence that the three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam terror attack were Pakistanis because Pakistani voter numbers of two out of three terrorists are available and the chocolates found with them were also made in Pakistan

title: Meghnad Desai, eminent Indian-born economist and author, dies at 85
content: Described as being at the “forefront of discussions on Indian public policy for many years”, Desai also had an illustrious teaching career

title: Rajnath urges international community to curb terror funding, labels Pakistan as ‘nursery of terrorism’ in Rajya Sabha
content: Defence Minister initiates debate on Operation Sindoor in Rajya Sabha; criticises UNSC’s appointment of Pakistan to counter-terror panel

title: Gujarat High Court acquits three in 2002 post-Godhra riots case, cites lack of ‘reliable evidence’
content: The three men were accused of being part of a mob in Anand that damaged and set shops on fire, violating prohibitory orders issued under Section 135 of the Bombay Police Act

title: DGCA audit flags 51 safety lapses in Air India’s operations
content: The Tata Group-owned airline is already facing warning notices for running planes without checking emergency equipment, not changing engine parts in time and forging records, along with other lapses related to crew fatigue management.

title: Assam begins eviction drive to clear encroached forest land on Nagaland boundary
content: The settlers had turned vast swathes of land in the Rengma Reserve Forest into betel nut plantations, officials said

title: Lawyers cannot be summoned by agencies for giving legal advice to clients: Supreme Court
content: The petitioners expressed concern over the ‘chilling effect’ that ‘arbitrary summoning’ could have on the legal profession

title: Fix accountability for Pahalgam attack, says Opposition
content: Lok Sabha member from Wayanad and Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asserted that leadership was not just about taking credit but also about owning responsibility

title: IUML, Sudheeran back Satheesan in dispute with Vellappally
content: Satheesan and Vellappally  had crossed swords after the latter alleged that minority vote banks, chiefly in north Kerala, wielded more political capital in the State than the majority community, principally the sizeable Ezhava community

title: Countdown begins for NISAR satellite launch on July 30
content: GSLV will lift off with 2,392-kg satellite at 5.40 p.m.; building a satellite on opposite sides of world during a global pandemic was really hard, but it strengthened ties with ISRO, say NASA officials

title: Tamil Nadu Skill Development Corporation inks MoU with Google Play to train students as game developers
content: A memorandum of understanding has been signed between the Tamil Nadu Skill Development Corporation and Google Play and Unity to train computer science students under the ‘Naan Mudhalvan’ programme

title: BMRCL likely to scale down tree felling target from 11,000 to 6,000 for metro phase 3
content: The BMRCL has proposed a compensatory afforestation initiative valued at ₹43.53 crore as part of its environmental monitoring strategy

title: Sub-Inspector couple suspended as the police probe their role in Tirunelveli caste killing
content: Preliminary investigation reveals that the accused made many calls to the victim in the last three days leading to the murder. The weapon used in the offence has been seized

title: Youth Congress workers stage protest at Anert office
content: Protest demanding probe into alleged irregularities and corruption involved in the implementation of the PM-KUSUM scheme

title: Andhra Pradesh government forms committees for Partnership Summit 2025 in Visakhapatnam
content: Summit to focus on economic transformation and industrial growth as part of Swarna Andhra@2047 vision

title: Education Ministry issues LOIs for four foreign universities to set up campus in India
content: Australia’s Western Sydney University (WSU), Victoria University, La Trobe University and U.K.’s University of Bristol will be establishing their campuses in the country by offering both undergraduate and postgraduate degrees

title: Indian officials reach out to post-Assad government in Syria
content: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) Joint Secretary Suresh Kumar, of the West Asia and North Africa division, met with the Syrian provisional government’s Foreign Minister Asaad Hassan Al-Shaibani

title: Constitute grievance panel for NEET candidates facing technical issues: Delhi High Court tells NTA
content: Court says exam time loss not due to candidates’ fault must be assessed by expert panel; directs transparent redress mechanism

title: CPI (M) leaders stop technicians from installing smart meters in Ongole
content: It is unfair to install smart prepaid meters without the consent of consumers and without explaining to them the risks associated with them, says CPI (M) Ongole secretary Ch. Srinivasa Rao

title: Smart ration cards to be given to 1.45 crore beneficiaries in A.P. from August 25
content: Andhra Pradesh became the first State in India to complete 96.05% KYC for ration cards, says Minister Nadendla Manohar

title: From the Texans to the 49ers, our ranking of every team based on under-25 talent
content: for the third straight year, the Houston Texans are no. 1 on this list of teams with the most under-25 talent . a year ago, the texans were way ahead of everyone else when it came to ranking talent under 25 years old .

title: Reinier de Ridder surges into the middleweight top 10
content: Reinier de Ridder is a top contender in the 185-pound division . he now owns a spot in the ESPN middleweight rankings, bumping Whittaker down a couple of spots in the top 10 . here are the current pound-for-pound MMA rankings .

title: 'It's about standards and details': Man United, Amorim aiming to start anew
content: Ruben Amorim arrived in the us for man united's preseason tour with a smile back on his face . he snapped back at reporters who suggested the performance had been poor . but time back in Portugal has allowed for a reset and at the start of a pivotal summer for the club .

title: 🎮 EA Sports reveals '99 Club' for Madden NFL 26

title: Why Ichiro, CC Sabathia and Billy Wagner are Hall of Famers
content: Ichiro Suzuki, CC Sabathia and Billy Wagner are inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame . the trio stands out for their disparate backgrounds . they were a star in the Japan Pacific League at 20 years old before becoming the first Japanese position player .

title: Brock Purdy and wife, Jenna, announce birth of first child
content: Purdy's wife, Jenna, gave birth to the couple's first child, millie Joleen . the 49ers' new arrival came nearly two weeks after star running back Christian McCaffrey and his wife had their first child .
